mpg_modified <- mpg %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(
    cyl = as_factor(cyl),
    fl = as_factor(fl),
    drv = as_factor(drv),
    class = as_factor(class),
    trans = as_factor(trans)
    )

# ℹ 52 more rows
mpg_modified %>% filter()
  gf_line(model~year)
mpg_modified %>% filter(manufacturer=='chevrolet') %>% 
  gf_line(model~hwy)
mpg_modified %>%
  group_by(manufacturer,cyl, fl) %>%
  summarize(average_hwy = mean(hwy), count = n())
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'manufacturer', 'cyl'. You can override
using the `.groups` argument.

  group_by(manufacturer,class,year) %>% 
  summarise(avg_high= mean(hwy), avg_city= mean(cty))
